at0000.1.description: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.

en.purpose: To record additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
en.use: Use to add IHE-XDS aligned metadata to a COMPOSITION.context, which along with existing COMPOSITION attributes, allows the composition to be registered in an IHE-XDS environment.

de.purpose: Zur Aufzeichnung vorausschauender Entscheidungen Ã¼ber die Gesamtabsicht der Pflege und mÃ¶gliche Interventionen, die in der Regel von einem Kliniker durchgefÃ¼hrt werden.
de.use:
Dient zur Aufzeichnung von vorausschauenden Entscheidungen Ã¼ber die Gesamtabsicht der Pflege und mÃ¶gliche Interventionen fÃ¼r eine Person. Die Entscheidungen unterstÃ¼tzen Kliniker, indem sie Hinweise auf mÃ¶gliche Behandlungen, AktivitÃ¤ten und diagnostische oder therapeutische Verfahren geben, die lebensrettend oder lebensverlÃ¤ngernd sein kÃ¶nnen oder unerwÃ¼nschte Nebenwirkungen verursachen. 

Dieser Archetyp soll als Teil einer integrierten Pflege- oder Lebensendplanung verwendet werden und nicht als Reaktion auf eine akute oder Notfallsituation. Jede Entscheidung sollte als Reaktion auf den allgemeinen Gesundheitszustand und die allgemeinen UmstÃ¤nde der Person getroffen werden und wird in der Regel von einem Arzt nach BerÃ¼cksichtigung der PatientenverfÃ¼gung oder der erklÃ¤rten PrÃ¤ferenzen der Person durchgesetzt.

Es kann unter bestimmten UmstÃ¤nden notwendig sein vorÃ¼bergehende Ãberschreitungen der Ã¼blichen VorausverfÃ¼gungen zu erfassen, z. B. wÃ¤hrend einer Schwangerschaft oder prÃ¤operativ. In dieser Situation wird es notwendig sein eine separate Instanz dieses Archetyps aufzuzeichnen, unter Verwendung einer Kombination aus relevanten GÃ¼ltigkeits- und ÃberprÃ¼fungsdaten.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Aufzeichnung einer "PatientenverfÃ¼gung" oder der PrÃ¤ferenzen der Person fÃ¼r die Pflege verwenden - verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck EVALUATION.advance_care_directive.

Nicht zu verwenden fÃ¼r die Aufzeichnung von Anordnungen, die als Folge der getroffenen und mit diesem Archetyp aufgezeichneten Entscheidungen erforderlich sind. Verwenden Sie fÃ¼r diesen Zweck spezifische Archetypen INSTRUCTION oder ACTION.

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere en forhÃ¥ndsbeslutning om den overordnede intensjonen med omsorg/behandling, samt hensiktsmessig behandling eller intervensjoner for et individ. Disse bestemmelsene er vanligvis tatt av en eller flere klinikere.
keywords: HLR-minus, R minus, resucitering, DNR, Do not resucitate, EoL, end of life, direktiv, behandlingsmÃ¥l, intervensjon, beslutning, livsforlengende, palliativ, gjenoppliving, forhÃ¥ndssamtale, forberedende samtale
nb.use:
For Ã¥ registrere en forhÃ¥ndsbeslutning om den overordnede intensjonen med omsorg/behandling, samt hensiktsmessige intervensjoner (inkludert behandling og tiltak) for et individ. Beslutningene vil stÃ¸tte klinikere ved Ã¥ fungere som retningslinjer knyttet til mulige behandlinger, tiltak og diagnostiske eller terapeutiske prosedyrer som kan vÃ¦re livreddende, livsforlengende eller fÃ¸re til uÃ¸nskede konsekvenser for individet.

Denne arketypen er tenkt brukt som en del av behandlingsplan eller plan for omsorg i livets sluttfase, og ikke gjort under tidspress i en akutt- eller nÃ¸dsituasjon. De enkelte beslutningene bÃ¸r vÃ¦re tilpasset individets overordnede helse og situasjon. Beslutningene blir vanligvis tatt av en eller flere klinikere, etter ogsÃ¥ Ã¥ ha tatt hensyn til individets og/eller pÃ¥rÃ¸rendes Ã¸nsker i form av livstestamente eller andre oppgitte preferanser.

Det kan vÃ¦re nÃ¸dvendig Ã¥ gjÃ¸re midlertidige avvik fra beslutningene i spesielle tilfeller, for eksempel ved svangerskap eller i forbindelse med en operasjon. Da vil det vÃ¦re nÃ¸dvendig Ã¥ lage separate instanser av denne arketypen, og sette de relevante gyldighetsdatoene i Protokoll-delen.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes for Ã¥ registrere individets livstestament eller andre personlige Ã¸nsker, bruk i stedet arketypen "Fremtidig behandlingsvalg" (EVALUATION.advance_care_directive).

Skal ikke brukes for Ã¥ forordne eller gjÃ¸re endringer i igangsatte tiltak, basert pÃ¥ bestemmelser gjort i denne arketypen. Bruk spesifikke INSTRUCTION- eller ACTION-arketyper til dette.

en.purpose: To record anticipatory decisions about the overall intent of care and possible interventions, usually asserted by a clinician.
en.use:
Use to record anticipatory decisions about the overall intent of care and possible interventions for an individual. The decisions will support clinicians by providing guidance regarding possible treatments, activities, and diagnostic or therapeutic procedures that may be life-saving, life-prolonging or cause undesirable side effects. 

This archetype is intended to be used as part of integrated care or end-of-life planning, and not as a reaction to an acute or emergency situation. Each decision should be made in response to the individual's overall health and general circumstances, and usually asserted by a clinician after consideration of the individual's advance care directives or stated preferences.

It may be necessary to record temporary overrides to usual advance intervention decisions in specific circumstances, for example during pregnancy or preoperatively. In this situation it will be necessary to record a separate instance of this archetype, using a combination of relevant validity and review dates.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record an 'Advance care directive' or the individual's preferences for care - use EVALUATION.advance_care_directive for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the orders required as a consequence of the decisions made and recorded using this archetype. Use specific INSTRUCTION or ACTION archetypes for this purpose.

at0000.1.description: Anticipatory decisions about the overall intent of care and possible interventions (including treatments, activities, and diagnostic or therapeutic procedures), asserted by a clinician.

at0043.1.comment: For example: the individual has no family.

en.purpose: To records details of the ability of an individual to use and understand information to make or consent to a decision, plan or intervention.
en.use:
Use to record details about the ability of an individual to use and understand information to make or consent to a decision, plan or intervention.

This archetype is intended to capture information about the mental capacity status of an individual, which is typically assessed in relation to a specific decision or plan that needs to be made about their medical care or treatment at a particular time. If specific details about the mental capacity assessments are required, additional archetypes can be nested within the 'Assessment details' SLOT.

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere detaljer om en person i en pasientjournal.
keywords: tjenesteyter, omsorgsperson, helsepersonell, slektning, pÃ¥rÃ¸rende, vitne, venn, nabo, barn, familie, sÃ¸sken, forelder, arbeidsgiver, rekvirent, henviser, ektefelle, verge, samboer, kjÃ¦reste
nb.use:

I tilfeller der det er nÃ¸dvendig eller Ã¸nskelig med detaljer om en eller flere navnekomponenter, bruk arketypen CLUSTER.structured_name i SLOTet "Strukturert navn" i denne arketypen. 
Om det er gjort, kan noen eller alle de strukturerte navnelementene slÃ¥s sammen av programvaren man benytter, og lagres i dataelementet "Navn".

en.purpose: To record details about a person as they are known or understood in the course of clinical documentation.
keywords: provider, carer, staff, healthcare professional, relative, next-of-kin, practitioner, witness, friend, neighbour, child, family, sibling, parent, individual
en.misuse:
Not to be used to represent or replace formal identification management or for the purposes of maintaining an official demographic register or index. Use a formal Master Patient Index or Health Provider Index for this purpose, or archetypes based on the openEHR Demographic Information Model.

Not to be used to represent the subject of care, participants or author of the record and similar data elements that should be represented formally in the health record using the Reference Model attributes.

Not to be used to record the date of birth of an individual - use the 'Date of birth' data element within the EVALUATION.birth_summary for this purpose

Not to be used to record biometric detail or biomarkers about an individual - use a specific ENTRY archetype for this purpose.

No debe utilizarse para registrar detalles biomÃ©tricos o biomarcadores sobre un individuo - utilice un arquetipo de ENTRY especÃ­fico para este fin.

de.purpose: Um Details Ã¼ber eine einfache, gesundheitsbezogene Dienstleistung oder AktivitÃ¤t, die von einem Kliniker, einer Organisation oder einer BehÃ¶rde erbracht wird, darzustellen.
de.use:
Zur Darstellung einer gesundheitsbezogener Dienstleistung oder AktivitÃ¤t, die von einem Kliniker, einer Organisation oder einer BehÃ¶rde bereitgestellt wird. Dies beinhaltet das Verfolgen des Fortschritts von der Planung Ã¼ber die Terminierung und Lieferung bis zur Fertigstellung sowie Abweichungen vom beabsichtigten Behandlungspfad wie Verschiebung oder Stornierung. Dies wird durch die Aufzeichnung relevanter Datenelemente zu bestimmten AktivitÃ¤ten erreicht, von denen jede als "Pathway"-Prozessschritte in diesem Archetyp beschrieben wird.

Der Umfang dieses Archetyps umfasst bewusst AktivitÃ¤ten fÃ¼r eine breite Palette klinischer Dienstleistungen, um als nicht spezifisches Archetyp fÃ¼r alle AnwendungsfÃ¤lle zu dienen. Beispiele hierfÃ¼r sind unter anderem:
- der selbstorganisierte Besuch eines Patienten zu einem vorsorglichen Check-Up bei einem Zahnarzt
- eine Reihe von Besuchen zu einem Physiotherapeuten zur Behandlung einer muskuloskelettalen Belastung
- die Ãberweisung einen anfordernden Gesundheitsdienstleister, wie zum Beispiel eines Hausarztes, an einen aufnehmenden Gesundheitsdienstleister, wie zum Beispiel einem Facharzt damit der Patient eine bestimmte Dienstleistung, Beratung oder Pflege erhÃ¤lt.

ZusÃ¤tzliche strukturierte und ausfÃ¼hrliche Informationen Ã¼ber diese Dienstleistung kÃ¶nnen, unter Verwendung eines spezifischen Archetyps der in den SLOT "Dienstleistungsdetails" integriert wird, dokumentiert werden.

Dieser Archetyp kann auf zwei Arten verwendet werden:
- als vollstÃ¤ndige Darstellung der erbrachten Dienstleistung, oder
- als Rahmen um vorrangig den Status der angeforderten Leistung und separaten OBSERVATION-Archetypen um die eigentlichen Testergebnisse fÃ¼r die erbrachte Dienstleistung darzustellen. Zum Beispiel mit dem Archetyp OBSERVATION.hearing_screening_result.

Die Zeitplanung im Zusammenhang mit einer Dienstleistung kann auf eine von zwei Arten verwaltet werden:
- durch die Verwendung des Referenzmodells - die Zeit fÃ¼r die AusfÃ¼hrung eines Schritts im Prozess wird das Zeitattribut des ACTION-Archetyps fÃ¼r jeden Schritt verwendet.
- durch die Verwendung von Archetyp-Datenelemente - das Datenfeld "Geplantes Datum/geplante Uhrzeit" ist dafÃ¼r gedacht einen Zeitpunkt aufzuzeichnen, zu der die Dienstleistung durchgefÃ¼hrt werden sollte. Hinweis: Das zugehÃ¶rige ACTION-Zeitattribut fÃ¼r den geplanten Prozessschritt wird die Zeit aufzeichnen, zu der die klinische AktivitÃ¤t in ein System eingeplant wurde, nicht das beabsichtigte Datum/die beabsichtigte Uhrzeit, an dem die AktivitÃ¤t durchgefÃ¼hrt werden soll.

In der Praxis werden einige Dienstleistungen (zum Beispiel in der ambulanten Versorgung) einmalig erbracht und nicht im Voraus bestellt. Die Details zu dieser Dienstleistung werden gegen den Schritt im Pfad "Dienstleistung abgeschlossen" hinzugefÃ¼gt. In einigen FÃ¤llen wird eine wiederkehrende Dienstleistung bestellt, und in diesem Fall werden bei jeder Gelegenheit Daten unter dem Schritt "Dienstleistung erbracht" erfasst, wobei die Anweisung im aktiven Zustand bleibt. Wenn die letzte Erbringung der Dienstleistung erfasst wird, wird die Aktion "Dienstleistung abgeschlossen" aufgezeichnet, um anzuzeigen, dass diese Anforderung nun im abgeschlossenen Zustand ist.

In anderen Situationen, wie der sekundÃ¤ren Versorgung, gibt es mÃ¶glicherweise eine formelle Anforderung einer Dienstleistung die dem Archetyp INSTRUCTION.request entspricht. Dieser ACTION-Archetyp kann dann verwendet werden um den Arbeitsablauf und die DurchfÃ¼hrung der Anforderung zu beschreiben.

Die Darstellung von Informationen mit Hilfe dieses ACTION-Archetyps deutet darauf hin, dass eine Art von AktivitÃ¤t tatsÃ¤chlich stattgefunden hat. In der Regel handelt es sich dabei um eine tatsÃ¤chliche Erbringung der Dienstleistung, kann jedoch auch einen fehlgeschlagenen Versuch oder eine andere AktivitÃ¤t wie die Verschiebung der Dienstleistung umfassen. Wenn es eine formelle Anforderung fÃ¼r die Dienstleistung gibt, wird der Status dieser Bestellung durch den Pathway-Schritt reprÃ¤sentiert, gegen den die Daten aufgezeichnet werden. Zum Beispiel kann der Fortschrittszustand einer Ãberweisungsanfrage mithilfe dieses Archetyps durch separate EintrÃ¤ge in den Fortschrittsnotizen der EHR bei jedem "Pathway"-Schritt erfasst werden:
- Aufzeichnung eines geplanten Startdatums/geplanter Uhrzeit fÃ¼r die Ãberweisung (Dienstleistung angesetzt), oder
- Aufzeichnung Ã¼ber eine vollstÃ¤ndig erbrachte Ãberweisung, mÃ¶glicherweise mit zusÃ¤tzlichen Informationen zur erbrachten Dienstleistung (Dienstleistung abgeschlossen).

Wenn die AktivitÃ¤ten den Ã¼blichen Geplanten > Angesetzten > Aktiven > Abgeschlossenen ZustÃ¤nden folgen, ist es in der Regel nicht notwendig, einen "Grund" aufzuzeichnen - vielmehr wird er in der Regel verwendet, um den Grund fÃ¼r Abweichungen vom typischen Versorgungspfad zu protokollieren.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass im openEHR-Referenzmodell ein 'Time'-Attribut vorhanden ist, das dazu dient, Datum und Uhrzeit zu erfassen, zu welchem Zeitpunkt jeder Schritt des Pfades der Aktion durchgefÃ¼hrt wurde. Dies ist das Attribut, das verwendet werden sollte, um den Beginn der Prozedur (unter Verwendung des Schritts "Dienstleistung erbracht") oder die Zeit zu protokollieren, zu der der Leistung abgebrochen wurde (unter Verwendung des Schritts "Dienstleistung eingestellt").
de.misuse: Nicht zur Darstellung von Informationen Ã¼ber durchgefÃ¼hrte AktivitÃ¤ten die spezielle Archetypen benÃ¶tigen, weil sie eine sehr spezifische Datenerfassung oder Anforderungen an Schritte des Pfades haben. Zum Beispiel: ACTION.procedure oder ACTION.health_education.

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere detaljer om en enkel helserelatert tjeneste eller aktivitet utfÃ¸rt av en kliniker, organisasjon eller virksomhet.
nb.use:
Brukes for Ã¥ registrere detaljer om en enkel helserelatert tjeneste eller aktivitet utfÃ¸rt av en kliniker, organisasjon eller virksomhet. Dette omfatter sporing av fremdrift fra planlegging, via tidfesting og utfÃ¸relse til fullfÃ¸ring, i tillegg til avvik fra det tilsiktede forlÃ¸pet, for eksempel utsettelse eller avlysning. Dette gjÃ¸res ved Ã¥ registrere informasjon i relevante dataelementer om de spesifikke prosesstrinnene i arketypen.

Denne arketypen omfatter aktiviteter for et bredt spekter av ukomplekse kliniske tjenester, for eksempel:
- egenhenvisning fra en pasient for kontroll hos tannlege til forebyggende behandling
- en serie konsultasjoner hos en fysioterapeut til behandling av muskel/skjelettbelastning
- en henvisning fra bestillende helsepersonell, for eksempel en fastlege, til mottakende helsepersonell, for eksempel et sykehus, for at pasienten skal motta en bestemt tjeneste, rÃ¥d eller behandling.

Ytterligere strukturert og detaljert informasjon om tjenesten kan registreres ved Ã¥ bruke formÃ¥lsspesifikke arketyper i SLOTet "Tjenestedetaljer", der det er nÃ¸dvendig.

Denne arketypen kan brukes pÃ¥ to mÃ¥ter:
- som en fullstendig oversikt over tjenesten som ble levert; eller
- som et rammeverk for Ã¥ registrere tilstanden til den forespurte tjenesten, med separate OBSERVATION-arketyper i samme templat, og som brukes til Ã¥ registrere de faktiske resultatene av den leverte tjenesten - for eksempel OBSERVATION.hearing_screening_result

Tidspunkter knyttet til en tjeneste kan administreres pÃ¥ en av to mÃ¥ter:
- ved Ã¥ bruke referansemodellen - tiden for utfÃ¸relse av ethvert prosesstrinn vil benytte ACTION time referansemodell-attributtet for hvert trinn; eller
- ved bruk av arketypedata - dataelementet "Tidfestet dato/tid" er ment Ã¥ registrere det nÃ¸yaktige tidspunktet nÃ¥r tjenesten er planlagt utfÃ¸rt. Merk: det tilsvarende ACTION-tidsattributtet for trinnet "Tjeneste tidfestet" vil registrere tiden da tjenesten ble planlagt i et system, ikke den tiltenkte dato/klokkeslett som tjenesten er ment Ã¥ bli utfÃ¸rt pÃ¥.

I praksis vil enkelte tjenester (for eksempel innen dagbehandling) skje Ã©n gang og ikke bestilles og planlagges pÃ¥ forhÃ¥nd. Detaljene om tjenesten vil bli lagt direkte til i prosesstrinnet, "Tjeneste fullfÃ¸rt". I andre tilfeller vil en gjentakende tjeneste bli bestilt, og i denne situasjonen vil data knyttet til trinnet '"Tjeneste utfÃ¸rt" bli registrert ved hver repetisjon av tjenesten, slik at den overordnede helsetjenesteaktiviteten blir vÃ¦rende i aktiv tilstand. NÃ¥r siste tjeneste er registrert, benyttes prosesstrinnet "Tjeneste fullfÃ¸rt" som viser at denne bestillingen nÃ¥ er i fullfÃ¸rt tilstand.

I andre situasjoner, for eksempel andrelinjetjeneste, kan det vÃ¦re en formell bestilling av en tjeneste ved bruk av en tilsvarende INSTRUCTION.service_request-arketype. Denne ACTION-arketypen kan deretter brukes til Ã¥ registrere arbeidsflyten for nÃ¥r og hvordan bestillingen er utfÃ¸rt.

Ved registrering av informasjon ved hjelp av denne arketypen indikeres det at en aktivitet faktisk har skjedd. Dette vil som oftest vÃ¦re tjenesteleveransen i seg selv, kan kan ogsÃ¥ vÃ¦re et mislykket forsÃ¸k eller en utsettelse. Dersom det finnes en formell ordinering av tjenesten, representeres statusen for ordinering ved prosesstrinnet som registreres. For eksempel kan denne arketypen brukes til Ã¥ fÃ¸lge fremgangen i behandlingen av en henvisning gjennom separate journaloppfÃ¸ringer, hver med sitt prosesstrinn:
- registrere dato/tiden tjenesten er ment utfÃ¸rt pÃ¥ ved hjelp av elementet "Planlagt dato/id" og prosesstrinnet "Tjeneste tidfestet"
- registrere at henvisningen er fullfÃ¸rt, potensielt inkludert informasjon om den leverte tjenesten, og prosesstrinnet "Tjeneste fullfÃ¸rt"

Dersom aktivitetene fÃ¸lger den vanlige flyten Planlagt > Tidfestet > Aktiv > FullfÃ¸rt, er det som regel ikke nÃ¸dvendig Ã¥ registrere en "Ãrsak". Elementet "Ãrsak" er ment brukt for Ã¥ angi hvorfor et forlÃ¸p avviker fra den typiske flyten.

VÃ¦r oppmerksom pÃ¥ at i openEHR referansemodellen er det et "Time"-attributt, som er ment Ã¥ registrere nÃ¥r hvert prosesstrinn i tjenesteaktiviteten ble utfÃ¸rt. Dette er attributtet som skal brukes til Ã¥ registrere starttidspunktet for tjenesteutfÃ¸ringen (ved Ã¥ bruke prosesstrinnet 'Tjeneste utfÃ¸rt') eller tidspunktet da tjenesten ble avbrutt (ved Ã¥ bruke prosesstrinnet 'Tjeneste avbrutt').
nb.misuse: Skal ikke brukes til Ã¥ registrere data om utfÃ¸rte aktiviteter som krever en spesialbygd ACTION-arketype fordi de har svÃ¦rt spesifikke data eller krav til prosesstrinn. For eksempel: ACTION.procedure eller ACTION.health_education.

pt-br.purpose: *To record details about a health-related service or activity delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency. This includes tracking progress from planning, via scheduling and delivery to completion, as well as deviations from the intended care path such as postponement or cancellation. (en)
pt-br.use:
*To record details about a health-related service or activity delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency. This includes tracking progress from planning, via scheduling and delivery to completion, as well as deviations from the intended care path such as postponement or cancellation. This is achieved by the recording of relevant data elements about specific activities, each of which are described as the 'Pathway' careflow steps in this archetype.

The scope of this archetype deliberately encompasses activities for a broad range of clinical services, to act as a non-specific archetype for all use cases. Examples include, but are not limited to:
- self-referral by a patient for a check-up visit to a dentist for preventive care
- a series of visits to a physiotherapist for management of a musculoskeletal strain; and
- a referral from a requesting healthcare provider, such as a primary care clinician, to a receiving healthcare provider, such as a specialist, for the patient to receive a specific service, advice or care.

Additional structured and detailed information about the service can be captured using purpose-specific archetypes inserted into the 'Service detail' slot, where required.

This archetype may only be used in two ways:
- as a full record of the service that was delivered; or
- as a framework to record primarily the state of the requested service, with separate OBSERVATION archetypes used to record the actual test results for the delivered service - for example OBSERVATION.hearing_screening_result.

Timings related to service management can be managed in one of two ways:
- Using the reference model - the time for performance of any pathway step will use the ACTION time attribute for each step.
- Archetyped data elements - the 'Scheduled date/time' data element is intended to record the time when the service was intended to be carried out. Note: the corresponding ACTION time attribute for the Scheduled pathway step will record the time that the clinical activity was scheduled into a system, not the intended date/time on which the activity is intended to be carried out.

In practice, some services (for example, in ambulatory care) will occur once and not be ordered in advance. The details about the service will be added against the pathway step, 'Service completed'. In some cases a recurring service will be ordered, and in this situation data against the 'Service delivered' step will be recorded on each occasion, leaving the instruction in the active state. When the last delivery of the service is recorded, the 'Service completed' action is recorded showing that this order is now in the completed state.

In other situations, such as secondary care, there may be a formal order for a service using a corresponding INSTRUCTION.request archetype. This ACTION archetype can then be used to record the workflow of when and how the order has been carried out.

Recording information using this ACTION archetype indicates that some sort of activity has actually occurred; this will usually be the service delivery itself but may be a failed attempt or another activity such as postponement of the service delivery. If there is a formal order for the service, the state of this order is represented by the Pathway step against which the data is recorded. For example, using this archetype the progressing state of a referral request may be recorded through separate entries in the EHR progress notes at each 'Pathway' step:
- record the scheduled Start date/time for the referral (Service scheduled); and
- record that the referral has been completed, potentially including information about the service delivered (Service completed).

When the activities follow the usual Planned > Scheduled > Active > Completed states, recording a 'Reason' is not usually necessary - rather, it is usually used to record the reason for deviation from the typical care pathway.

Please note that in the openEHR Reference Model there is a 'Time' attribute, which is intended to record the date and time at which each pathway step of the Action was performed. This is the attribute to use to record the start of the service (using the 'Service delivered' pathway step) or the time that the service was aborted (using the 'Service abandoned' pathway step). (en)
pt-br.misuse: NÃ£o deve ser usado para registrar dados sobre atividades realizadas para atividades que exigem um arquÃ©tipo ACTION construÃ­do para esse fim, pois elas possuem requisitos muito especÃ­ficos de registro de dados ou de etapas do caminho. Por exemplo: ACTION.procedure ou ACTION.health_education.

en.purpose: To record details about a simple health-related service or activity delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency.
en.use:
To record details about a simple health-related service or activity delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency. This includes tracking progress from planning, via scheduling and delivery to completion, as well as deviations from the intended care path such as postponement or cancellation. This is achieved by the recording of relevant data elements about specific activities, each of which are described as the 'Pathway' careflow steps in this archetype.

The scope of this archetype deliberately encompasses activities for a broad range of clinical services, to act as a non-specific archetype for all non-complex use cases. Examples include, but are not limited to:
- self-referral by a patient for a check-up visit to a dentist for preventive care
- a series of visits to a physiotherapist for management of a musculoskeletal strain; and
- a referral from a requesting healthcare provider, such as a primary care clinician, to a receiving healthcare provider, such as a specialist, for the patient to receive a specific service, advice or care.

Additional structured and detailed information about the service can be captured using purpose-specific archetypes inserted into the 'Service detail' slot, where required.

This archetype may only be used in two ways:
- as a full record of the service that was delivered; or
- as a framework to record primarily the state of the requested service, with separate OBSERVATION archetypes used to record the actual test results for the delivered service - for example OBSERVATION.hearing_screening_result.

Timings related to service management can be managed in one of two ways:
- Using the reference model - the time for performance of any pathway step will use the ACTION time attribute for each step.
- Archetyped data elements - the 'Scheduled date/time' data element is intended to record the time when the service was intended to be carried out. Note: the corresponding ACTION time attribute for the Scheduled pathway step will record the time that the clinical activity was scheduled into a system, not the intended date/time on which the activity is intended to be carried out.

In practice, some services (for example, in ambulatory care) will occur once and not be ordered in advance. The details about the service will be added against the pathway step, 'Service completed'. In some cases a recurring service will be ordered, and in this situation data against the 'Service delivered' step will be recorded on each occasion, leaving the instruction in the active state. When the last delivery of the service is recorded, the 'Service completed' action is recorded showing that this order is now in the completed state.

In other situations, such as secondary care, there may be a formal order for a service using a corresponding INSTRUCTION.request archetype. This ACTION archetype can then be used to record the workflow of when and how the order has been carried out.

Recording information using this ACTION archetype indicates that some sort of activity has actually occurred; this will usually be the service delivery itself but may be a failed attempt or another activity such as postponement of the service delivery. If there is a formal order for the service, the state of this order is represented by the Pathway step against which the data is recorded. For example, using this archetype the progressing state of a referral request may be recorded through separate entries in the EHR progress notes at each 'Pathway' step:
- record the scheduled Start date/time for the referral (Service scheduled); and
- record that the referral has been completed, potentially including information about the service delivered (Service completed).

When the activities follow the usual Planned > Scheduled > Active > Completed states, recording a 'Reason' is not usually necessary - rather, it is usually used to record the reason for deviation from the typical care pathway.

Please note that in the openEHR Reference Model there is a 'Time' attribute, which is intended to record the date and time at which each pathway step of the Action was performed. This is the attribute to use to record the start of the service (using the 'Service delivered' pathway step) or the time that the service was aborted (using the 'Service abandoned' pathway step).
en.misuse: Not to be used to record data about activities carried out for activities that require a purpose built ACTION archetype because they have very specific data recording or pathway step requirements. For example: ACTION.procedure or ACTION.health_education.

nl.purpose: Om gegevens vast te leggen over een eenvoudige gezondheidsgerelateerde dienst of activiteit geleverd door een arts, organisatie of instantie.
nl.use:
Om gegevens vast te leggen over een eenvoudige gezondheidsgerelateerde dienst of activiteit geleverd door een arts, organisatie of instantie. Dit omvat het bijhouden van de voortgang van planning, via het maken van afspraken en levering tot voltooiing, evenals afwijkingen van het geplande zorgpad zoals uitstel of annulering. Dit wordt bereikt door het vastleggen van relevante gegevenselementen over specifieke activiteiten, die in dit archetype elk worden beschreven als de zorgstroomstappen 'Pathway'.

De reikwijdte van dit archetype omvat bewust activiteiten voor een breed scala aan klinische diensten, om te fungeren als een niet-specifiek archetype voor alle niet-complexe use cases. Voorbeelden zijn onder andere
- zelfverwijzing door een patiÃ«nt voor een controlebezoek aan een tandarts voor preventieve zorg
- een reeks bezoeken aan een fysiotherapeut voor de behandeling van een overbelasting van het bewegingsapparaat; en
- een verwijzing van een aanvragende zorgverlener, zoals een huisarts, naar een ontvangende zorgverlener, zoals een specialist, om de patiÃ«nt een specifieke dienst, advies of zorg te laten ontvangen.

Aanvullende gestructureerde en gedetailleerde informatie over de dienst kan worden vastgelegd met behulp van doel-specifieke archetypes die waar nodig worden ingevoegd in de sleuf "Dienstinformatie".

Dit archetype mag slechts op twee manieren worden gebruikt:
- als een volledig verslag van de geleverde dienst; of
- als een kader om voornamelijk de status van de gevraagde dienst vast te leggen, met afzonderlijke OBSERVATION-archetypes die gebruikt worden om de eigenlijke testresultaten voor de geleverde dienst vast te leggen - bijvoorbeeld OBSERVATION.hearing_screening_result.

Timings met betrekking tot servicebeheer kunnen op twee manieren worden beheerd:
- Met behulp van het referentiemodel - de tijd voor de uitvoering van elke padstap zal het ACTION tijd-attribuut voor elke stap gebruiken.
- Archetypische gegevenselementen - het gegevenselement "Geplande datum/tijd" is bedoeld om het tijdstip vast te leggen waarop de dienst uitgevoerd zou worden. Opmerking: het overeenkomstige ACTION tijd-attribuut voor de stap Geplande route registreert het tijdstip waarop de klinische activiteit in een systeem werd gepland, niet de beoogde datum/tijd waarop de activiteit zou worden uitgevoerd.

In de praktijk zullen sommige diensten (bijvoorbeeld in de ambulante zorg) eenmalig plaatsvinden en niet vooraf besteld worden. De gegevens over de dienst worden toegevoegd aan de stap 'Dienst voltooid'. In sommige gevallen wordt een terugkerende dienst besteld, en in deze situatie worden de gegevens voor de stap "Geleverde dienst" bij elke gelegenheid geregistreerd, waardoor de instructie in de actieve status blijft. Wanneer de laatste levering van de dienst wordt geregistreerd, wordt de actie 'Dienst voltooid' geregistreerd, wat aangeeft dat deze opdracht nu in de status 'voltooid' staat.

In andere situaties, zoals secundaire zorg, kan er een formele opdracht zijn voor een dienst met behulp van een overeenkomstig INSTRUCTION.request archetype. Dit ACTION archetype kan dan worden gebruikt om de workflow vast te leggen van wanneer en hoe de opdracht is uitgevoerd.

Het vastleggen van informatie met behulp van dit ACTION archetype geeft aan dat een of andere activiteit daadwerkelijk heeft plaatsgevonden; dit zal meestal de dienstlevering zelf zijn, maar het kan ook een mislukte poging zijn of een andere activiteit zoals uitstel van de dienstlevering. Als er een formele order is voor de dienst, wordt de status van deze order weergegeven door de Pathway stap waartegen de gegevens worden geregistreerd. Bij gebruik van dit archetype kan de voortgang van een verwijzingsverzoek bijvoorbeeld worden vastgelegd door middel van afzonderlijke vermeldingen in de voortgangsnotities van het EPD bij elke stap van het pad:
- de geplande begindatum/tijd voor de verwijzing vastleggen (dienst gepland); en
- vastleggen dat de verwijzing voltooid is, eventueel met informatie over de geleverde dienst (dienst voltooid).

Als de activiteiten de gebruikelijke Gepland > Afspraak gemaakt > Actief > Voltooid toestanden volgen, is het vastleggen van een 'Reden' meestal niet nodig - het wordt eerder gebruikt om de reden voor afwijking van het typische zorgpad vast te leggen.

Let op dat er in het openEHR Referentiemodel een attribuut 'Tijd' is, dat bedoeld is om de datum en tijd vast te leggen waarop elke stap in het zorgpad van de Actie werd uitgevoerd. Dit is het te gebruiken attribuut voor het vastleggen van de start van de dienst (bij gebruik van de stap 'Geleverde dienst') of de tijd dat de dienst werd afgebroken (bij gebruik van de stap 'Dienst afgebroken').
nl.misuse: Niet te gebruiken om gegevens vast te leggen over uitgevoerde activiteiten voor activiteiten waarvoor een speciaal gebouwd ACTION-archetype nodig is omdat zij zeer specifieke vereisten inzake gegevensregistratie of trajectstappen hebben. Bijvoorbeeld: ACTION.procedure of ACTION.health_education.

at0000.1.description: A simple health-related service or activity delivered by a clinician, organisation or agency.

author.name: Silje Ljosland Bakke, John Tore Valand, Terje Sagmyr
Ana Paula Pannuti, DÃ©bora Farage, Adriana Kitajima, Fernanda Maia e ClÃ³vis Puttini.
